• __version__
  • old_module
  • module
   1 # -*- coding=utf-8 -*-
   2 """
   3 This library is a set of compatibilty access shims to the ``pip`` internal API.
   4 It provides compatibility with pip versions 8.0 through the current release. The
   5 shims are provided using a lazy import strategy by hacking a module by overloading
   6 a class instance's ``getattr`` method. This library exists due to my constant
   7 writing of the same set of import shims.
   8 
   9 Submodules
  10 ==========
  11 
  12 .. autosummary::
  13     :toctree: _autosummary
  14 
  15     pip_shims.models
  16     pip_shims.compat
  17     pip_shims.utils
  18     pip_shims.shims
  19     pip_shims.environment
  20 
  21 """
  22 from __future__ import absolute_import
  23 
  24 import sys
  25 
  26 from . import shims
  27 
  28 __version__ = "0.5.2"
  29 
  30 
  31 if "pip_shims" in sys.modules:
  32     # mainly to keep a reference to the old module on hand so it doesn't get
  33     # weakref'd away
  34     if __name__ != "pip_shims":
  35         del sys.modules["pip_shims"]
  36 if __name__ in sys.modules:
  37     old_module = sys.modules[__name__]
  38 
  39 
  40 module = sys.modules[__name__] = sys.modules["pip_shims"] = shims._new()
  41 module.shims = shims
  42 module.__dict__.update(
  43     {
  44         "__file__": __file__,
  45         "__package__": "pip_shims",
  46         "__path__": __path__,
  47         "__doc__": __doc__,
  48         "__all__": module.__all__ + ["shims"],
  49         "__version__": __version__,
  50         "__name__": __name__,
  51     }
  52 )
